body:
Looks like CPU version of expand and bmm cause serious slow downs in backward. Repro:
```
weight = Parameter(th.Tensor(1, 1024, 1024))
inp = Variable(th.randn(64,1024,1), requires_grad=True)
target = Variable(th.randn(64,1024,1))

for i in range(10):
    forward_start = time.time()
    output = th.bmm(weight.expand(inp.size(0), 1024, 1024), inp)
    print("forward time " + str ( time.time()-forward_start ) )
    
    crit = nn.MSELoss()
    target = Variable(th.randn(*output.size()))
    loss = crit(output, target)
    
    backward_start = time.time()
    d = loss.backward(retain_variables=True)
    print("backward time " + str ( time.time()-forward_start ) )

```

Cuda version does not show a slow-down.
